metadata.title: CVE-2022-44793 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
handle_ipv6IpForwarding in agent/mibgroup/ip-mib/ip_scalars.c in Net-SNMP5.4.3 through 5.9.3 has a NULL Pointer Exception bug that can be used by aremote attacker to cause the instance to crash via a crafted UDP packet,resulting in Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44793` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6
libsnmp-perl - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6
libsnmp35 - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6
snmp - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6
snmpd - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6
snmptrapd - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6
tkmib - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.6').
